result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell Rakeem Herron

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mitchell Rakeem Herron not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Mitchell Rakeem Herron.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of  PRELIMINARY HEARING( 18 pages) commencing 08-04-22 by Kristin Menzia.

Defendant Mitchell Rakeem Herron in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Defendant Mitchell Rakeem Herron in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 17CF599. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Eric Rom. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Mitchell Rakeem Herron not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Due to calendar congestion Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Stephen Sargent

Defendant Mitchell Rakeem Herron not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mitchell Rakeem Herron not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Mitchell Rakeem Herron in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Mitchell Rakeem Herron in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
